channel.title: [looking for contributor] wiki page appearance needs some improvement [html]
channel.description:
Not written in stone, means, we can discuss this further.
1) Whonix's documentation table of contents (https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Documentation) does not look well.
It could need markup changes to look more pretty. Here is an example that looks more pretty: https://anonymous-proxy-servers.net/en/help/index.html
This can be done with some html, div etc inside the wiki markup. Just hit the edit button in the wiki.
2) Whonix's Contribiute page (https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Contribute) does not look well.
A table formatted look would be more pretty.
(For example, the Donate page (https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Donate) is already using such tables.)
Here is a contribute page that looks better: https://tails.boum.org/contribute/index.en.html
Whonix could also use such icons. Colored ones would be preferred, though. We don't have to create such icons. We can use ones, that are under Free (as in speech) licenses (FSF approved). [If you're interested, we can sort out the licensing here. No big deal.]
